body:
@iress-ac we have identified an issue and re-released the stable docker image.
We believe this will fix this problem - can you confirm its ok for you now?
It's no better for us at the moment, we're still seeing the same errors.
And confirm you have pulled the latest image? üòÅ

I just swapped it to pulling the latest version explicitly by tag, `2.12.0` and it's working again! Thanks for the speedy resolution.

I'm curious - how did it spontaneously break for the last stable image?

issue.title: Running an OWASP Full Scan via Github Action ( zaproxy/action-full-scan@v0.4.0 ) results in an error

repository.name: action-full-scan
repository.description: A GitHub Action for running the ZAP Full scan

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

An error is being thrown when trying to run a full scan via Github Actions. The errors started happening today without any changes to the workflow.

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

1. Run an Owasp Zap Full scan using a Github Action zaproxy/action-full-scan@v0.4.0
2. Scan fails with an error

### Expected behavior

Scan completes correctly

### Software versions

zaproxy/action-full-scan@v0.4.0

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Errors from the zap.log file

[Zap Log.txt](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/files/10881939/Zap.Log.txt)


### Additional context

_No response_

### Would you like to help fix this issue?

- [x] Yes

rename.to: Exceptions during update of add-ons with dependents with optional Extensions

body:
It looks like you have uncovered an issue in the core when updating some add-ons.
This is somewhat surprising as we have released these add-ons before without any problems.
We are investigating the core issue so that we can fix it in the next release and understand when it could re-occur.
The workaround (which we did this time) is to update the stable image with the latest add-ons - then theres no need to update them and the problem wont occur.

issue.title: Remove add-on `ResourceBundle` on soft uninstall

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Remove the `ResourceBundle` when soft uninstalling, it's added back when reinstalled, same logic as when uninstalling the add-on except for the add-on files which are not removed.
This could cause log of errors during the update of the add-ons (should not affect functionality, it would use the same data), e.g.: `ERROR ‚Ä¶.I18N - Adding message bundle with duplicate prefix: retire`

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#7765.

issue.title: Unload dependent extensions on soft uninstall

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Unload all the dependent extensions of the add-ons soft uninstalled, otherwise the unload would happen later when the dependencies were no longer available.
Use the ID of the add-ons in some logging instead of the name.

Fix #7765.

issue.title: pscanrules: update minimum commonlib version
issue.body:
Require 1.13.0 as minimum, the `HeartBleedScanRule` scan rule requires that version.

Noticed while working on zaproxy/zaproxy#7765.
It would lead to an exception when installing the add-on, e.g.:
```
ERROR AddOnLoaderUtils - Failed to initialise: HeartBleedScanRule
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: 'void CommonAlertTag.putCve(Map, String)'
    at HeartBleedScanRule.<clinit>(HeartBleedScanRule.java:76) ~[?:?]
‚Ä¶
```
